Figured it would be difficult not to enjoy the food in my state of hypoglycemia. Unfortunately, I was disappointed by all the food because the flavors were either too oily, salty, sweet or bland. Overall, my problem with the food was that it did not taste authentic. The restaurant most likely  westernized the traditional dishes to cater to a specific audience but with their traditional decor of paper lanterns you'd expect the food to be traditional! Don't come here for authentic Shanghai food, do go if you just want a westernized version.
author: Peachie Y.

description: It's not like dumplings are hard to find in San Francisco, is it? But when I came across this cozy neighborhood spot on Monterey in the netherlands between Glen Park and whatever the area between it and 280 is called, I knew SDK would become a go-to spot for those delectable little chinese food pillows I love so well. It's not just dumplings, either. The chow mein is nice and thick, the vermicelli egg noodles perfectly thin but chewy the way i like them, and there's a healthy mix of meat and vegetarian options to please just about any palate. The other night we had the special prawn and chive dumplings and they were outstanding. I've been to SDK three or four times now and have never been disappointed. I'll be back soon because there's still lots and lots of things to try
author: Lonnie L.

description:
been here a few times.. a good place to go if you are craving xiao long bao and other pot sticker/ wonton like foods. 

their xiao long bao (famous dumpling with soup inside) is a must. #4. dont forget, #4!
the flavor is delcious, meat is seasoned perfectly, not too overpowering or salty. when it is still hot, becareful of the soup inside the wonton as this is quite hot. 

hot to eat a xiao long bao:

you will need a chinese soup spoon and chopsticks as provided by the restaurant.

carefully pick up the wonton with the chopstick at the very tip of the wonton.

lay the wonton on your soup spoon, pierce through a hole in the side with the chopsticks and sip the soupy yummy delicousness from it. 

then proceed to eat the entire thing once the soup is gone.

easy right?! YASS. lol 


*you'll thank me for this one day =D
author: Steve S.

description: My first time at Shanghai Dumpling King I cried.  No, I'm not joking nor exaggerating; the food was that good! Though the tears may have been from the heat of the famous Shanghai soup dumplings.  Go with a group, bring friends, and dig in.  I would eat here everyday if I could.  Downside is it's location which is a decent distance outside of the city.
author: Bryce B.

description: Good, reliable food.  Not the best, but not the worst.  Service is mediocre, but delivered with genuine enthusiasm and very knowledgeable.  They DO speak English and were very helpful to those of us who weren't quite familiar with all the offerings.
author: Diane M.

description: Got delivery through Caviar. Calamari taste like ammonia. Like a cat came and pissed directly into my food, and then I ate it. Yeah... that went straight to the trash. Never again.
author: Mike T.

description: Yummy dumplings finally moved a location close to our home. Comfort food with lots of choices. Quick service.
author: Valerie S.

description: The grab and pork dumplings are the best. Every time I come into the city, I head to this place for breakfast and it is the first thing I order. However, Wednesday was my first time at the new location.The reason why I took off one star is because of the waiter. The young one with the wannabe Korean hair style, he was VERY rude and not attentive whatsoever.  Good new: The dumplings are still fantastic and the egg puffs are just as delicious as I remember. Therefore, 4 stars it is.
author: Julie L.

description: New favorite dumpling spot!
author: Rachel S.

description:
I came here for a dinner with my friend tonight, and I am absolutely not going to come back to this place because of their rude customer service! I ordered a pork dish( I don't remember the exact name of it) and it wasn't fully cooked, so I told the server that we would like to exchange for another one. He came with an attitude and said, " I can't do anything about it!" Then handed us the check. Really bad customer service! 
Btw, my friend is a native Shanghainese, and he said the dumpling in this restaurant is not a shanghainese traditional style dumpling, it's more like a Cantonese style there.
author: John F.

description:
This is significantly less crowded than the Balboa St. location.  It is unclear to me that this is a temporary move as other reviews above may have mentioned; I think this may be a second permanent location.  Anyways, it is much more accessible than the Richmond location, and the food seems to be the same.

We come for the soup dumplings, and don't have much by way of expectations for the other dishes.  But we were surprised by their spicy chicken wings.  But of course, we gorged ourselves on soup dumplings.

The service was awesome, seemingly even better than Balboa.  Perhaps it is because there were plenty of servers to help us out.
author: Jon S.

description: They change the owner or the chef? The food tastes horrible, service is bad. Would not come back again.
author: Amy A.

description: Food is decent; the Shanghai dumplings were the only mediocre item. The others tasted bland and the price was on the pricier side for food that wasn't tasty.
author: Emily L.

description:
After a year and a half I returned with a friend for lunch.  The place was still cheap.  I ordered Mongolian beef and a friend ordered Kung paw chicken.  My Mongolian beef had a good flavor but the beef was so chewy and tough I got tired of chewing the meat.  I left half of the meat uneaten. 

The service was still slow and still had that same don't care attitude.  We went there around 12:30 and only 3 tables.  Does the owner ever read this review? By this time, they figure they need to change it up to bring in more customers in.  Also, they don't take credit card under $20 so take cash if it's only for one or two.
author: donald c.

description: Dumpling heaven! I love this place- and I can never eat enough of their super tasty, flavorful, amazing, moist, Shanghai dumplings! My fav!
author: S R.

description: Great dumpling dive. Shrimp and vegetarian jewels to die for.  Ownership team gets it.  If this place was in the Mission, the friendly ownership would charge 1.5 times the current prices and still clean up.  Located in a residential neighborhood, this Monterey Blvd. standout good has a pork and shrimp centric menu. Have suggested chicken, but hey, they stick to what works best.  Note: parking is restricted on the immediate side street.
author: eric s.

description: I guess location is everything. I like this place better than the other in Balboa. Same owners though from what i've heard. Everything is good here and affordable. Fridays and weekend do get crowded so plan on coming early to avoid being elbow to elbow with peeps who have stanky body odor.
author: Spooky B.

description:
The xiao long bao here just cannot be beat! Price, flavor, juicyness, after taste, even the greasy bits that squirted onto my shirt when I failed to bite into them properly was heavenly.

The newer location is LOADS cleaner and more spacious than the old one. I love the home cooked feel of the dishes, and their Shanghai Lion Head meatballs are probably the best I've ever had (the spinach in that dish complements the meat perfectly... You gotta eat this over a bowl of white rice, so amazing).

Service was friendly and quick, and they finally accept credit cards! 

You gotta make a visit if you haven't already. :)
author: Huan L.

description: Maybe I went on an off day, but I was underwhelmed. I really, really wanted to like this place because it's close to me. However... meh.
author: Michael S.

description: Shanghia Dumpling King is better than Kingdom of Dumpling after having tried both in the same week.  The dumplings while very similar in the texture/thickness/price (and the 2nd degree mouth burning capabiity), SDK wins for the taste.  The green beans is also done perfect at SDK -- fried at a high enough heat to retain the crunchiness of the beans and yet cooked through.  Best of all, you get to end your meal with fluffy egg puffs.
author: Anna C.

description:
Three of us came here for brunch/lunch on a Sunday. By the time we left, the small restaurant was packed with a waiting line. 

We were pretty hungry so we ordered quite a lot of food. We consulted the highlights on yelp and were not disappointed! 

Shanghai Xiao Long Bao: Bigger than I expected. They were piping hot when they came out. So much soup and goodness. They were wonderful. 

Shanghai style noodles (stir fry): Greasy, but what is chinese food without the grease? They were very yummy and full of flavor. Comes in a rather big portion. 

Spicy Chives and Pork Dumpling: Although it says spicy, it is not very spicy at all. It has a little kick but very mild. Dumplings are definitely homemade which is nice that they dont give you some store bought stuff. 

Pan Fried Pork Buns: By the time this came out, we were all stuffed but we had to fit fit this one in. Eight buns comes in one order. They are nice and crunchy on the bottom. They are also good leftovers. 

Sugar Egg Puffs: We did not order this dish but the lady came by and said it was delicious so we caved. We were so full when we got to this. But this was so amazing, none of complained! So light and fluffy. One of the best I've ever had. 

We are so satisfied, we are still talking/thinking about it 4 days later. It was THAT good.  Cheap, quick and delicious.
author: Michelle T.

description: One word to describe their food is YUMMY!! I came here on a Friday, we got there a little early and beat the crowd. When it's not busy the service is good. We ordered green onion pancake, 2 xiao long boa, sweet soymilk, and egg puffs for dessert. My favorite item was defiantly the xiao long boas, they were delicious! Each one bursting with delicious soup. They made the skins slightly thinker than the ones on Balboa street but it wasn't that big of a deal. They're much better than the places on Taraval because they have more soup in them. The soymilk was perfect, not too sweet. The green onion pancake was alright, i wish it had more layers in them. Finally, the egg puffs were yummy too. They were really airy inside and they didn't add too much sugar like most places.
author: Luna C.

description: Definitely do NOT recommend this place. I'm writing this as I recover from food poisoning from having eaten here earlier today...... I had some xiao long bao, cucumber salad, and two boiled chive & pork dumplings. And to top off getting sick off of it, it wasn't even good food. The dumplings were made of crappy ingredients, sloppily made, full of MSG... I was excited when I saw that they'd opened nearby, but after my first try I'm NEVER going back.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I love this place for the XLB. The soup, the meat, and the skin for the XLB is made perfectly. The skin didn't break like other xlb i've had at other restaurants, which was impressive.The onion pancake is super delicious at this restaurant too. The shanghai chow mein is another good dish to order with the XLB. The restaurant is cleaner and bigger then the original on Balboa too. Parking may be difficult but I normally park in the residential area up the block. The XLB is definitely a crowd favorite of this restaurant and worth a try.
author: Jason L.

description: Ten dumplings for about six bucks - hit the spot on a cold night in the city!  You gotta eat those things quickly though, because as soon as they get cold the soup thickens and is much less appetizing.  As most chinese restaurants go, the service leaves something to be desired, but it was to be expected.  I'd come back for the cheap good eats!
author: Pam S.

description: This is the first time that we went to this location, we are pretty much were happy with all of the food!  Having learned from my previous experiences, I decided to get the veggie steamed buns and the onion pancake.  As usual, very solid dishes and left content.  Would come back here given the ease of the location and lack of the crowds.
author: Sheetal P.

description: We went here about 2 weeks ago. Their dumplings are great. My son loves them! We'll definitely come back to try other things on their menu since I had a craving for some dumplings. My husband enjoyed the sugar egg puffs but I find it them okay only.
author: Yen B.

description: Excellent xiao long bao, wonton soup and guo bu li. Avoid the green scallion pancake. Came here with my mom and mom-in-law and they both gave it a big thumbs up. Wait staff is also super friendly.
author: Alice W.

description:
Went there to check out new location. The food is as  good as the original one on Balboa. Very different layout, more roomy and the tables are larger. We ordered the dumplings, excellent as usual, the little burst of broth just makes it. The garlic green beans was cooked perfectly, tender but still toothsome. Order the Lion's Head in broth, comes with black mushrooms, napa cabbage, cellophane noodles, super good. We also had the mix meat with hand pulled noodles, you can see we like noodles. Talked to one of the partners, he said he'll go back to the other location when it opens in about 10 days. His other partner will stay and run the Monterey site.

One big plus is the unmetered parking. Also they take credit cards with a $20 min. order.
author: bob l.

description:
I came here because I needed something to eat. The service is horrible.  I ordered 4 items and 1 of them was a soup. The soup was the last item that was delivered.  To make things worse we were not even given a bowl to split it up for 2 people. I even had tp ask for forks.
 The soup as overly greasy and has no flavor. It was just hot water and oil.



 Overall the food is ok not great

I'm never going to be back.
author: Al O.

description: Yummmm - just had a lovely dinner here. Went there because nothing else was open for Christmas and as tourists we didn't have any family dinner to go to. Although the place was packed, fast service and delicious food. The noodle dish was a tad bit salty, but overall great food. We loved the Shanghai style dumplings and vegetables, as well as the Sugar Rice Puff dessert!!!
author: Birgit T.

description:
parking is SO DIFFICULT around here.  

okay, this is just on the take out.  and only one dish.  BUT I'LL BE BACK and HOPEFULLY RAISE THIS TO A 4...gIve them a chance cuz the food smelled and looked incredible.

i went in and ordered a mushu pork because i was in a rush and my normal place where is REALLY crunchy was closed while the people went on vacation.

The mushu was not really crunchy but the pork was more than enough and tender.  the veggies tasted fresh but there was SO MUCH juice it soaked the pancake through...but good pancakes.

What i saw while i was there...i saw everything from the dumplings to other foods and they looked and smelled incredible.

the service was fast and friendly so i'll want to try this place again when i get the chance.  Sit down and enjoy it.  Lots of people were there.
author: Bing D.

description: Ive been here several times on weekday evenings around 6pm. It's usually not that crowded so we never have to wait. I really like their xlb, pan fried pork buns, and garlic snow pea leaf veggies. Prices are absolutely affordable here. I think this place is suitable for groups of 2-3, but also 6-8 as well since they do have one or two large tables. Each time Ive gone, there was always one large group there. Parking is just on the street and we tend to get a spot within the block.
author: Ratigon L.

description: I'm glad there's a dumpling place that's kinda near my house. We got the shanghai dumplings and fried noodles. The dumplings were pretty good and cheap. 10 for $5.50. The noodles, on the other hand, were not that great. It had a weird taste to it. I forgot which noodles we ordered but I will just stick to dumplings next time. I will definitely return. The service was satisfactory, nothing too spectacular.
author: Vivian L.

description: Delicious! I'm a huge fan of this place. Shanghai dumplings, green beans, and combo fried rice are a must.
author: Julie B.

description: Umm XL dumplings with Zero soup in it!! WTF I don't need to continue this review after that comment. Fine the beef stew soup noodle was the only thing with good flavor. The spicy wontons were mushy in the middle, the thick shanghai noodles mushy and wet, just bad!
author: Karen T.

description: The location is great, I found parking and close to home.  At this part of town there's a void of Chinese food.  I'm not particularly a dumpling eater because of the dough skin. The wrappers on the dumplings were very thick.  This is a step out of my comfort zone.  I do enjoy the fry-rice which is a bit heavy.  Other reviewer have mention that over all the food is on the greasy side and he's right.  The portion is generous so I took most of the food home and have another entire meal later.  This is a cheap dumpling place to have a quick bite and one should not expect too much.
author: Lantz G.

description:
I've been to both SDK locations and was generally happy with the food at both.  This location is just a quick drive via 280 from where I live in SOMA, far more convenient than going to Outer Richmond.

The XLBs have a lot of soup, though it tastes a little too sweet to me.  I do like the consistency of their skin-- just thick enough to properly hold in the soup without being too doughy.  I took some home and reheated them the next day and they stayed in tact.

I would pass on the green onion pancake unless you like them super fried and flat/dense.  It lacks the airy and layered texture that I like.
author: S L.

description:
enjoyable

had the pork dumplings, spicy wonton, and spicy deep fried chicken wings- all of which were above average compared to other places ive tried
author: Danny K.

description: I'm a huuuuuge fan of dumplings and this place just nailed it! First off, the service was great. So friendly and helpful. The lady recommended the special which was a prawn and chive boiled dumpling. I highly recommend this! Super good! & last but not least, the star of the show!! Shanghai Dumplings or also known as Xioa Long Bao. The flavor of the soup, the tenderness of the meat.... Perfect. If you're in the mood for dumplings, this is your go to spot! So underrated yet so gooood.
author: Krystal H.

description:
We were disappointed. We went for the luncheon special. The hot and sour soup was very tasty but luke warm. The onion pancake was undercooked and gummy. The sweet and sour pork was overwhelmed by the sauce and had no pineapple, hence there went the "sweet." part The garlic eggplant was swimming in oil. Portions were quite sparse, mostly rice on the plate. 

Try Alice's on 29th and Sanchez for dynamite Chinese food.
author: mary h.

description: Finally, a good restaurant in the area! The other location on Balboa was my favorite dumpling place in the sf. So glad the decided to open a location near my house.
author: Francis G.

description: Their food is still very good, but the service was extra surly. Some of the staff were quite nice, but one was so curt and dismissive that I'm wondering if I'll go back.
author: Ozma S.

description: We have been big fans of the Outer Richmond location, but it was just so far away and hard to get to.  NOW, they are nearby and not such a long wait!  YAY!  The dumplings are great when they are fresh.  We also love the homemade Shanghai noodles.  And you cannot leave without the sugary sweetness of the popover-like Chinese donuts. And best of all, it's very inexpensive!  Welcome to the South side SDK!
author: Erwin B.

description: The most terrible dumplings I have had in my life. There are not Shanghai dumplings because they put too much soy sauce and make it too small. These dumplings  will kill people who like dumplings. Only Cantonese and Americans can eat these fake things because they don't know what is real dumplings of the Shanghai style. Also the horrible Cantonese waiters and waitresses service will ruin your good mood and appetite with terrible dumplings.
author: Kenny K.

description: I'm rating this 5/5 because I am ONLY interested in their XLB. After moving here from NYC, I lamented the loss of the delicious soup dumplings from the east coast chinatown. I read about SDK in the weekly, and Lo! The best XLB I've ever had, bar none. Worth it for those alone.
author: Augustine T.

description: This is a reply for Vanessa M's picture of shanghai noodles. Shanghai noodles aren't supposed to have sauce! Most Chinese food doesn't have heavy thick sauce to it. If it does, it's cooked for people that don't know Chinese food.
author: T C.

description: Food was pretty good but service was horrible. The waiter (balding asian man) was rude and the first words he said to us was hurry up. They were busy but wtf? I wanted to leave but we really wanted to try the dumplings.
author: David K.

description: Maybe if you're Asian, this place is cool. If not, I suggest going elsewhere because as far as I can tell, the staff here is all racist and doesn't like serving people who aren't Asian.
author: Najla A.

description: Dumplings are always good, however not necessarily at this establishment. The stuffing with ea/dumplings was lacking flavor for my taste. The wrapping of the dumplings were very amateurish since the stick not very firm, and didn't have any integrity in keeping the meat wrapped inside (which i must note was not a very generous amount). The spicy chives dumpling were especially disappointing. They were very lackluster in execution, only adding some hot chili sauce on top of regular chive dumplings. I was hoping that the hot chili sauce would be incorporated as part of the stuffing inside of the dumplings. However, I am giving the restaurant 3 stars because the green onion pancakes were pretty good and the price was very affordable.
author: Max M.

description: This place sucks balls. Nothing special food isn't any good, service & cleanliness are disgusting
author: Len A.

description: Best Chinese food in SF.  Yeah, I said it.  And I don't take that lightly.  Not super fancy, not plated for presentation.  But, super delicious, cheap, not greasy Chinese food.  Everything on the menu is good, but for first timers I recommend shanghai dumplings or spicy wontons, shanghai noodles or chow fun, mu shu, and pea shoots.  But really, you can't go wrong.
author: Shelby P.

description: This place has the best dumplings on this side of The City for sure!!!! Best comfort food I can find in the area!! My boyfriend and I have tried dumplings from other restaurants and they simply DO NOT COMPARE! Every single item on the menu that we have tried has not disappointed us by any means...we get take-out from here at least twice a month and it is always just as delicious as the time before. Why this place doesn't have at least 4 stars is simply a mystery to me! Try it and won't regret it!
author: Jacki W.

description: Delicious Food and in my neighborhood, I couldn't ask for more!!!  Not to miss items: Chicken wings, garlic green beans, pea shoots, all dumplings and DONUTS!!!!!!  Wish the delivered at lunch!!!!  Maybe soon (:   -1 star for ambiance, there is none.
author: Kate T.

description: I have only tried dumplings here and a couple of other dishes and everything has been great!. No idea if the dumplings are authentic or not, and I don't care. The spicy wontons, and Shanghai dumplings have been awesome every time I've had them.  Green beans and chicken wings are yummy too. I always get take out and the food really is ready in 10 minutes, as promised. The folks who work here are super nice and friendly.
author: Lisa M.

description: Ob-sessed. I have gone through a couple phases of eating here every week and I'm on one now and have been for over 2 months. I used to go to the other location but i like this one because it's bigger and closer to me. I love the spicy wontons, shanghai dumplings, crab and pork dumplings, pea shoots, fried pork buns, the wings, the shangha noodles... jeez. Really everything. YUM. Perfect hangover food too.
author: Burleigh Girl G.

description: A good variety of Chinese food, servers are pretty nice. But the food is very greasy and salty. Because there is one place across the street, and another next to Safeway (50 ft away) , I would not come here again unless the  other places are not available. Why eat crappy food when you have two other places that are the same prices, and taste much much better.
author: Sandie Y.

description: if you're looking for the "ding tai fung" style of buttery, soupy xiao long bao then you'll probably be disappointed. dumplings are larger and sweeter, everything else is tasty but a bit too salty, and I would look elsewhere to get your fix of shanghainese dumplings. that being said, this is still a pretty decent .chinese restaurant and worth the visit if you live nearby.
author: Sherman L.

description: Great value.  Food is consistent and very good.  Service can be spotty but as long as you understand that going in its not much of an issue.  Glad its in the neighborhood now (but wouldn't travel to it if it wasn't close by).
author: John B.

description: Not as good as it used to be before the move. Food feels alright but not spectacular. Friendly staff tho
author: Danielle A.

description:
What we ate:
The xia long bao (shanghai soup dumplings) were pretty good.  Sometimes pork dumplings have an unpleasant gamey flavor when they aren't prepared correctly, but this place knows how to prepare dumplings.      
We also ordered spicy beef tendon which my husband found too salty but lacked flavor.
The onion pancake was just ok.  This one didn't come out as crispy as I like it.  I would skip it the next time I'm here.  
The jia jian mein (minced porked noodles) were far from any jai jian mein I've ever had.  I liked them but they probably need to be named something else.  The dish came out as thin egg noodles with minced pork, cucumber, and some sauce over them.  The noodles reminded me of the type you get in won ton noodle soup.
For dessert we got the sugar egg puffs.  They were nice and fluffy but too oily.  The top of the puff was perfect but the oil seemed to pool to the bottom of the puff. 
Over all: 
The meal was pretty inexpensive so I think it was worth it.  The next time I come back I would order the xia long bao and maybe try the wonton noodle soup or more dumplings.
author: Tabitha S.

description: This is my first visit to this new location, came today (Sunday) at 11am and there were only two other tables with people. I was pleasantly surprised to not have to wait in line. It's naturally much bigger and cleaner than the one in Balboa since it's new.  Of course we ordered the Xiao Long Bao, one order of 10 for each of us, these dumplings didn't have as much soup inside as I remember but still good. It was my first time to try the spicy dumplings and I enjoyed the slight peanut flavor and it had just the right amount of spice.  The peashoots  with a garlice went well with today's dumpling feast, the egg puff sugar doughnut was the icing! This is enough to satisfy me for a month or so.
author: Flaneur E.

description: What a value! 2 orders of meat (8) and vegetarian (8) potstickers were $12. Filling enough for a meal for 2. Chef Jia's potstickers are better, but for the value, quality, ease of parking, and proximity to home, it's a regular joint. Service is good. They accidentally gave me a meat potsticker in my vegetarian potsticker order on my first visit, and were very apologetic and quick to fix it. Mistakes happen, but they handled it well, all was forgiven, and we went back the next week.
author: Presto G.

description: Fantastic place for Shanghai Soup Dumplings in SF. Great value and good authentic food.  Our party of 3 did not have to wait too long for a table on a Friday night at 8.   Basic atmosphere, clean, lively but not too loud.  Will be back.
author: Susanne M.

description: My parents are from Shanghai and I have tasted some amazing Shanghainese food all my life.  The food here is nothing close to it.  The Shao Lon Bao was full of fat, Shanghai Wan Ton had very little of what it resembles as meat except they were full of fat also.  The flavor is not fresh and very little chives in it.  Shanghainese noodles did not have the right texture either.  Very disappointed but for a neighborhood restaurant, I can see people will still tolerate it since it's close enough.
author: L. H.

description: Wow, I love this place. Great dumpling, spicy fish, chicken chow mein etc. Food is flavorful without being over salty or greasy. Reasonable pricing and great for groups family style meals or take out. So happy they opened in my neighborhood!
author: Pete C.
